name: Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel

reviews.text: This is my second time in this hotel and as a regular Athens visitor I hope to be back for more.
reviews.title: Trully Grande

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything good said on this website is true: this is a truly luxurious place, nothing is pretentious, and top quality service is provided. Breakfast and lunch was once again memorable.
reviews.title: No wonder this hotel has multiple awards!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally managed to try out the SPA. Exceeded my expectations, the sports massage after the marathon was incredible and even though the therapists were massagging runners for most of the day, their last appointment with us was of the best quality. The only negative was the unprofessional and snobbish approach of the spa manager but we received a written apology from her boss.
reviews.title: Scammed by hotel chauffeur; no response from management

reviews.text: And yes, it's expensive, but people should not complain, this is the best hotel in Athens, I stayed in all of them, so you have to pay. Otherwise just stay in Plaka
reviews.title: Definition of luxury, location doesn't get any better than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed at Grande Bretagne hotel and was truly impressed! The hotel has won multiple awards and the reviews were good, which inspired us to stay here. Indeed no regrets! Booked from tigerhotels.co.uk. The hotel is in perfect location near all landmarks as a result breath taking views from the rooms. From top to bottom this hotel has everything one could ask for. There is roof garden restaurant to enjoy the sunsets, the Spa for pure indulgence and the cellar for tasting over 3,000 bottles of wine! The rooms are decorated in classic greek decor with panoramic views. The staff was friendly and helpful. All in all it was a great hotel and I wish we could have spent valentines here!
reviews.title: Classy hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We had Deluxe Suites with butler service, this was the most amazing and beautiful Hotel I have ever stayed at. The Rooms were gorgeous no detail left out. The Service at this hotel was above and beyond. Everyone was always so nice and professional. It is located in a great part of Athens if you want to walk to see the sites or do shopping. Right across the street from the Parlimant. If you want a limo driver to take you to your sites that is also available and a very nice service. We were there for 9 days and hated to leave. In one word
reviews.title: WOW, the most AMAZING, service!!

reviews.text: AMAZING!!!
reviews.title: undisclosed fees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grande Bretagne in Athens is a hotel of legend, and historical note. During WWII the German Command stayed there. Winston Churchill stayed at a different time.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with an incredible view

reviews.text: You would be hard pressed to find any view to compare with the view of the Acropolis from the rooftop restaurant with a 5* choices on the menu. When the weather is nice there are tables outside dressed in white linen.
reviews.title: Exceptional service, from A to Z. Truly a REAL 5 star hotel !

reviews.text: The rooms vary in size and décor , but the one I had had warm yellow tones, silk drapes, a crystal chandelier, a seperate dressing room and a marble bath.
reviews.title: Stunning roof top terrace

reviews.text: The Grande Bretagne truly is the grande dame of Athens and the staff and management team live and breathe the highest ideals of hospitality.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel + Fantastic Service

reviews.text: The only concern I had prior to arrival was the hotel's condition, given that the extensive renovation was in 2003. To my pleasant surprise, the rooms and common areas looked as if they had been finished just before my arrival. There were no frays, chips, and stains that are often found in less recent renovations, which told me that management keeps a watchful eye on the small details and is willing to invest in maintenance even in times of a sour economy and to that I say Bravo!
reviews.title: The BEST hotel in Athens !!!
World-class spa facilities, excellent restaurants, close to tourist attractions
reviews.text: As others have said, the buffet breakfast on the 8th floor is outstanding and the view to the Acropolis peerless, especially at night or at early breakfast while the hill is still floodlit.

reviews.title: A truly "Grande" experience
reviews.text: The spa is also quite excellent and a good respite in mid-day heat or at the end of hours of touring.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have a number of views, so if one wishes to see the Parliament or the Acropolis, check with the hotel or SPG to make sure you reserve the correct room type and also share your preferences with the hotel. I found them to be extremely accomodating, especially as only a limited number of rooms have the Acropolis view.
reviews.title: Surely one of the finest hotels in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess you know already that the location, views, staff and hotel itself are just great. We were using this hotel as a stopover before a cruise and were unlucky in that it rained so for roughly 36 hours we did not go out of the hotel. No problem. The spa is wonderful with amazing thermal suites that are complementary for hotel guests. I got a great pedicure that lasted perfectly till the end of our cruise. Alexander's Bar was a comfortable snug and a fantastic place to watch the Athen's fashionable (rich?) set. But the best thing was the food. Whether casual dining at GB Corner or dinner at GB Roof Garden the food was superb - particularly the fish - not cheap but worth it. Would not stay anywhere else when we return to Athens.
reviews.title: A destination in itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful location for anything, right off Embassy row. Lots of great food within walking distance. Athens is a great city, and this is the perfect location to rest after a busy day.
reviews.title: Luxury in the perfect location

reviews.text: This one is also one of the best i have ever stayed. It has the best location at syndgma and the best roof top in town. You can see from the roof top the acropolis. Spectacular view. The hotel is a very old and luxurious place. The inside of the building is so beautiful and specious. Th rooms are incredible. I have state 2 times there. Once in a deluxe room which is also very specious and oncein a suite. Amazing bathrooms and huge with marble make you feel like a littel king. The service is very good and the hotel stuff always tries to help you where they can. Also when they have demonstrations at syndagma square its the best protected hotel i ever saw. Police and security everwhere. its right in the middel of athens and surrounded by shops and the plaka which is the old city of athens. they can make every wish you request to come true. of corsou not cheap but if u have the budget try it. its worthy. One of my favorites places. and in europe the best hotel i ever stayed.
reviews.title: A very luxurious hotel in the heart of athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spa is amazing and free to hotel guests. glistening mosaic and have 4 rooms including hot stones, steam room, sauna and foot jacuzzis. lovely pool with a small waterfall. changing rooms with lockers, robe and flip-flops. spacious showers with toiletries and hairdryers. i loved it!. french style decorations in the rooms with a view of the parliament square for the changing of the guards. gorgeous breakfast but not sure if its worth 35 euros in the rooftop restaurant. free umbrellas from concierge, late checkout till 3pm...bliss. free computer and internet in business centre
reviews.title: luxury in a box
A "real" Palace Hotel
reviews.text: I already have eaten at the rooftop restaurant of the Grande Bretagne but since now didn't have the chance to stay. Truly, it was a wonderful experience. Staffs is amazingly helpful, the room had a terrace with a view on the Syntagma square, the Parliament and the Acropolis which could be noisy but thanks to the sealed windows, the room remains quite. The spa is amazing and I would advise to go the hairdresser: she’s a fairy! Pool on the rooftop to enjoy an appetizer at sunset ...mmmmmm! Without doubt, the hotel deserves its stars and the price. Didn't try the breakfasts, which seems a bit overpriced. My only wish: come again.

description: With breathtaking views of the famed Acropolis and Parthenon, regal Constitution Square and the Parliament, lush Lycabettus Hill, or the original Olympic Stadium, the Hotel Grande Bretagne offers unrivaled perspectives of Athens' mythical history. Each of the 320 guest rooms offers enchanting views of the hotel courtyard or a spellbinding panorama of the city's timeless landmarks, while the exquisite interiors pay homage to Greek culture with intricate moldings and classic decor.
